Cube Title: Percentage of workforce teleworking or working remotely, and percentage of workforce able to carry out a majority of duties during the COVID-19 pandemic, by business characteristics
Archive Status: CURRENT - a cube available to the public and that is current

Product Id: North American Industry Classification System (NAICS), all industries
Mining, quarrying, and oil and gas extraction
Real estate and rental and leasing
Administrative and support, waste management and remediation services
Business size of employment, all employment sizes
Majority ownership, First Nations, Métis or Inuit
Majority ownership, person with a disability
Workforce teleworking or working remotely prior to February 1st, 2020
Workforce teleworking or working remotely on March 31st, 2020
Workforce still able to carry out a majority of their duties

Cube Title: not available for a specific reference period
less than the limit of detection
value rounded to 0 (zero) where there is a meaningful distinction between true zero and the value that was rounded
suppressed to meet the confidentiality requirements of the Statistics Act

Product Id: Territories include: Yukon, Northwest Territories, and Nunavut.
This includes all employees who would receive a T4. Excluded from number of employees are business owners, contract workers and other personnel who would not receive a T4.
Includes businesses owned or controlled by a government agency.
Majority-owned: Ownership is comprised of 51% or more.
Respondents were asked to provide the percent of their business’s workforce on February 1st, 2020, that was still able to carry out a majority of their duties.
Figures may not add to 100% due to rounding.
